result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Court Trial exhibits from 10/13/22 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 793
Stipulation for Destruction of Original Exhibits; received and filed.
Exhibit List - Court Trial; received and filed.

Defendant George Lee Veal in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for George Lee Veal. Kyle Elderkin, under the student practice rule, appeared with Attorney Gerald Henry Alder . for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Court trial. Trial proceeded.  
Sworn for the State: Tory R .
Exhibit 1, 3; received into evidence. 

Sworn for the State: Police Officer Edgar Rodriguez, City of Milwaukee.
Exhibit 4; received into evidence. 

State rests.

Defendant sworn and give his testimony. 
Cross Examination.

Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: Police Officer Mark Sheremeta, City of Milwaukee.
Exhibit 2; received into evidence

State and Defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Closing arguments by state and defense. 

Court placed findings of facts on the record. 

Court finds the State has met its burden by clear and convincing evidence and finds defendant guilty. 

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing. Case remain Calendared in Branch 2.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed: State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed.

Defendant George Lee Veal appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for George Lee Veal.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a final pre-trial.  Matter remains in trial posture.  No outstanding issues or motions raised by the parties.  State will file an Order to Produce.  Court Trial remains calendared on October 13, 2022 at 1:30 PM in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.

Court scheduled a final pre-trial on October 6, 2022 at 11:00 AM.  Court Trial remains calendared on October 13, 2022 at 1:30 PM.  Parties notified of court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.

Defendant George Lee Veal in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant George Lee Veal in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing. Defense filed a Jury Trial Waiver form. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right to jury trial. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Court trial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant George Lee Veal not in court, in custody.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (10 pages) commencing 5-19-22 by  Amy De La Rosa.

Defendant George Lee Veal in court, defendant in custody with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent, appear by video.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  MPD Officer M. Sheremeta.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 2.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant George Lee Veal not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Sargent to be appointed pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with All Walgreens stores in Milwaukee County, and their employees.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant George Lee Veal in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant George Lee Veal in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  George Lee Veal appeared by video means with Attorney.  Due to assignment of Assistant District Attorney, the defendant is advised that case is reassigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
